answerText: diols[10] Strong oxidizing agents can cleave the carbon-carbon sigma bond in a vicinal diol to yield compounds containing this functional group, which consists of a carbon atom double bonded to an oxygen atom.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | MIT A + LASA B | 3 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Oxidation of alkenes with osmium tetroxide can be used to synthesize these compounds. For 10 points each: [10] Name these compounds with geminal and vicinal types, whose most common example is ethylene glycol.
